Bari A. Williams has transformed from corporate lawyer to leading Silicon Valley diversity advocate

• Introduced our Display Options panel within the reader, complete with font styling, color themes, and in app brightness settings.• Consolidated complex and repetitive UI-specific code to convenience static methods and categories.• Converted some of our bloated legacy view controllers to our new MVVM standard, allowing for intuitive, well defined abstraction.• Designed and created our first testing suite for our release and debug iOS builds. Test coverage includes: integration/regression tests for our RESTful APIs, JSON mock tests to validate our Core Data injection, snapshot and automation tests for our UI, and unit tests for our models and view controllers.• Implemented our new payments system with tokenized credits, and establishing multiple tiered user roles. • Designed APIs for the introduction of sheet music books, articles, magazine issues, and implementing our new UI and seamless UX throughout the app to go along with the feature release.• Implemented paginated carousel layouts with fluidity, reusability and performance in mind. Designed a framework for displaying and producing a myriad of styles and variants for each of our content types.• Architected an internal UI components SDK to allow for our team to quickly produce our high quality content defined by our branding style guide. Including, but not limited to, immutable and efficient control, image, font and color APIs. • Methodically pairing our Core Data models with Swift structs to allow for performant, immutable, thread-safe mirroring.• Implemented caching patterns to handle efficient Objc-Swift interoperability, which allows for models to be shared a between an innovative and legacy code base. • Designed an analytics API which incorporates a factory and strategy pattern to provide an abstract interface to be utilized throughout our code, by allowing each concrete instance to define its own implementation according to business constraints.

At PXPGraphics.com, we bring together a new style and approach to create beautiful, eye-catching designs. Success is our only goal. We want to have an efficient and modern method of the design process. We accomplish this with skills in both technical and creative fields, we approach design as artists who have the ability to develop high quality, well-functioning projects. Our passion for design is behind our philosophy: "Design is beautiful, elegant, and attractive. Most great companies have at least one thing in common: a great understanding of design and utilizing it to its capacity. The styles of the recent years are constantly updating and evolving. Companies need to adapt fast to the trends that are forming around them. The tradition methods of advertising and design are outdated and inefficient, and companies should have an option to progress; and that's what we're here for."

Marqeta is the first multi-merchant prepaid debit card solution that will change the way you shop – and change the way merchants interact with you. Current projects include: Building and maintaining our native iOS apps, developing the Marqeta Mobile SDK, and overseeing our visual design overhaul. Utilizing the following libraries: AFNetworking, CocoaLumberjack, DateTools, Kiwi, MBProgressHUD, Nocilla, OHHTTPStubs, Parse, SDWebImage, Prior projects included: Creating and implementing brand strategy, B2B/B2B2C, and direct B2C marketing/advertising, B2B & B2C email marketing and layouts (CSS3 & HTML5), creating in-store POS collateral, and designing/developing the iOS/Android native mobile apps (Objective-C, Swift, Cocoa, Cocoa Touch, CoffeeScript & Java).
We are an integrated marketing company and website services provider focused on helping businesses and organizations achieve their online marketing goals.

The degree in Marketing, with a minor Advertising, offered a strong core of advertising, public relations, and communication courses, to give me hands-on experience in professional communication environments.The degree in Visual Communication allowed me to fine tune my aesthetic and cognitive skills using art, design and technology to creatively communicate ideas and transform messages into visual communication.

All undergraduate and alumnus members of The Delta Chi Fraternity have joined hands in fighting cancer together and named The V Foundation for Cancer Research as its preferred philanthropic organization.Each year, Delta Chi chapters and colonies raise tens of thousands of dollars for international and local charitable organizations. It is the hope of Delta Chi that if all chapters unite their services and resources to benefit a single organization, Delta Chi can make a greater impact on that organization.
recommendations: Ayana Sellassie, M.S.
User Experience Research, Design, & Strategy
February 1, 2017, Ayana worked with Paris Xavier in different groups

If I could define Paris in one word, it would either be dedication or brilliance. Working at Marqeta with Paris, I learned of his great work ethic to get things done and to take on challenges to learn things he didn't already know that would help the development of the Marqeta brand and website. It's impossible not to be inspired by his impeccable dedication. His knack for thinking of innovative ideas  is contagious. I watched him evolve from a graphic designer to a web developer, coding for the iOS mobile platform. Beyond his skills in development and design, his strong business acumen made it great to work with him, as he always considered strategic planning of where the company could go depending on design and development decisions. Paris' skills make him a triple threat, and I know he will flourish as a leader in his career. I look forward to the opportunity to work with him again.

Mark Lopez
COO at iControl Data Solutions
February 3, 2015, Paris Xavier worked with Mark in the same group

Paris and I worked together at Marqeta for over 2 1/2 years. I always enjoyed every moment working with Paris. Paris brings tremendous intelligence and a very strong work ethic to everything he does. I admire how Paris moved from a Designer role to and IOS engineering role with almost zero guidance. That was a remarkable accomplishment. Paris played a key role in shipping our mobile apps as well as mentoring other designers. His contributions were significant and his ping pong matches were fierce. I hope I get the opportunity to work with Paris again!

Professional Makeup Artist
June 2, 2011, Lauren was a client of Paris Xavier’s

Paris, with PXP Graphics, was a pleasure to work with.  I was in need of a logo, and within the first day of talking to Paris I already had sketches waiting for me in my inbox.  Not only was he quick, but his work was quality.  Paris was very patient with me during the process and was able and willing to offer assistance after the transaction was finalized.  I strongly recommend Paris to anyone at any level; whether you are clueless as to what it is you're looking for, to being picky and compulsive over your design, Paris will get it done.

Ayana Sellassie, M.S.
User Experience Research, Design, & Strategy
April 19, 2015, Paris Xavier worked with Ayana in different groups

Working with Ayana was a true pleasure! Her motivation, problem solving and patience was an asset to our support and client services teams at Marqeta.During my role as a designer, Ayana helped clarify user flows and showcased other potential roadblocks that a typical user may see while using our products—it helped having a user ambassador within your own office.Years later, during my role as a developer, Ayana and I discussed wireframes and concepts to for our early mobile app prototypes. This helped us tremendously to prevent potential bugs and edge cases while writing the source code.Overall, Ayana was a great asset and I hope to work with her again on another project!

summary: Specializing in market research and advertising campaign management to graphic design and creative direction, Paris has held positions in advertising and marketing as well as design and development.Currently, he is utilizing his advanced understanding of design (conceptual & UI/UX) for native iPhone & iPad apps while evolving his skills as an iOS Engineer with Xcode, Cocoa Touch, Objective-C and Swift with the Scribd team. While following SOLID principles, Clean Code, Agile, and TDD/BDD methodologies.He's currently working on a handful of side projects to accentuate his understanding of design and development for both web and mobile—My Daily Grind (http://www.mydailygrind.io/), VLNRABLE (http://www.vlnrableapp.com/), myRoommates (coming soon), Core 40 (coming soon).Prior to his position with Scribd, Paris has worked for several companies in the Pacific (California, Oregon, Washington, Nevada, Arizona, and Colorado), where he has refined his skills in the Adobe Creative Suite, FQL, HTML5, CSS3, HAML, SASS/SCSS/LESS, C, Python, Javascript, jQuery, Xcode, photography, photo editing, painting and audio & video editing.
name: Paris Xavier Pinkney
title: iOS Engineer at Scribd
